question.content: Students were asked to write the historical events in the ||| order of their occurrence . ||| Matriculation Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 4) ||| |||

options.text: Laid down ||| The phrase “laid down” means surrendering or putting ||| something down. Hence, ‘Laid down’ is the most appropriate ||| answer. ||| Sol.221. |||
down to earth- very realistic and sensible. ||| down to it- focused on the task at hand. ||| down to bottom- at the lowest point. ||| down to drown- to sink under water and die. ||| Sol.222. |||

Advised against ||| The verb ‘advise’ is often followed by the preposition ‘against’ ||| when giving a warning to avoid something. Hence, ‘advised ||| against’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.223. |||

||| chronological ||| order- in the order of their ||| occurrence. ||| Aesthetic order - organize things in a way that emphasizes their ||| beauty. ||| Historic order - ||| arranging things based on their historical ||| importance or relevance. ||| Diachronic order - organizing things based on their evolution or ||| changes over time ||| SSC CHSL 2022 Tier - 2 |||

question.content: The numbers applying for the course had dropped off ||| very sharply during the pandemic. ||||||Pinnacle ||| Sentence Improvement ||| Higher Secondary 05/08/2022 ( Shift - 2 ) ||| |||

options.text: had dropped off sharply ||| Solutions :- ||| Sol.434. |||
Bargaining ||| ‘Bargain’ means to discuss and negotiate. Hence, ‘Bargaining’ is ||| the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.436. |||
Treated with scorn ||| ‘Disdained’ means to be Treated with scorn or unworthy of one's ||| consideration. Hence, ‘treated with scorn’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. ||| Sol.437. |||
In ||| The phrase “Cave in” means to collapse; subside. Hence, ‘cave in’ ||| is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.438. |||
The heart rending cries ||| ‘Heart Rending’ means something that causes you to feel great ||| sadness and pity. Hence, ‘the heart rending cries’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. ||| Sol.440. |||
Went from rags to riches- to start your life very poor ||| and then later in life become very rich. ||| Sol.441. |||
Generally accepted agreement ||| In the Sentence ‘Consensus’ means generally accepted ||| agreement. Hence, ‘Generally accepted agreement’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. ||| Sol.442. |||
against ||| ‘Forward’ must be replaced with ‘against’ as the phrase ‘go ||| against’ means to oppose or resist something. Hence, ‘against’ ||| is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.443. |||
Native village ||| ‘Native’ means associated with the place of a person's birth. ||| Hence, ‘native village’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.444. |||
Anecdotes - Short accounts of real and interesting ||| incidents. ||| Sol.445. |||

will think that the writer is ||| ‘Thought’ must be replaced with ‘think’ as we generally use V 1 ||| with the helping verb will. Hence, ‘will think that the writer is’ is ||| the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.446. |||

For you and me ||| Replace ‘I’ with ‘me’ in the sentence. Because we never use ||| subjective cases in objective places. Hence, ‘he brought these ||| sweets for you and me’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.447. |||

Which district ||| In the given sentence ‘which’ used as a function word to ||| introduce a relative clause that modifies a noun ‘the introductory ||| session’. Hence, which distinct is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.449. |||

but neither of them knew it ||| ‘No one’ must be replaced with ‘neither’ as we generally use ‘no ||| one’ to denote more than two subjects ‘neither’ to denote two ||| subjects. Hence, ‘but neither of them knew it’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. ||| Sol.450. |||
This is one of the most beautiful places in the area. ||| The superlative degree of the adjective beautiful is ‘most ||| beautiful’. Hence, option |||
is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.451. |||

I told him my innermost feelings. ||| In the given sentence the correct superlative degree of ||| comparison is ‘Innermost feelings’. Hence, ‘I told him my ||| innermost feelings’ is the most appropriate sentence. ||| Sol.452. |||

One of the bad habits. ||| According to the Subject Verb Agreement Rule “One of the + ||| Plural Noun + Singular helping Verb” the most appropriate option ||| ‘One of the bad habits’ can substitute the underlined segment in ||| the given sentence. ||| Sol.453. |||
David looks older than he really is ||| The correct comparative degree of the adjective ‘old’ is ‘older’. ||| Hence, option |||
is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol.454. |||
